results.title: The Escort = La Scorta
results.creator_credit: Claudio Bonivento Productions, Claudio Bonivento and Ricky Tognazzi
results.brief_description: La Scorta is the rivetting story of a judge and the four carbinieri officers assigned to protect him and their attempts to fight corruption in Sicily. The film opens with the violent death of a judge and his escort. Judge Michele de Francesco (Carlo Cecchi) volunteers as his replacement and soon discovers that corruption has infiltrated all levels of the community. Soon he finds that the only people he can trust are the four men assigned as his bodyguards, Angelo Mandelosi (Claudio Amendola), Andrea Corsale (Enrico Lo Verso), Fabio Muzzi (Ricky Memphis) and Raffaele Frasca (Tony Sperandeo). The five men risk their lives and the safety of their families in order to fight corruption in the Sicilian town. Ricky Tognazzi directs a seat-gripping thriller which comments on corruption in modern Italian society. With a musical score by Ennio Morricone. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Ernie game
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Allen, Gordon Burwash and Don Owen
results.brief_description: A mid-winter romantic feature filmed in Montreal, although the story could take place in any city where those young people live who have left their parents’ homes but still have not made homes of their own. Ernie’s alienation is far more extreme than most. For him life is a game, not because he chooses to make it so, but because he is unable to make anything more of it. But for those who befriend him and eventually turn him loose again, his game is not enough. (Awards: Toronto; Barcelona.) Cast: Jackie Burroughs, Anna Cameron, Leonard Cohen, Corinne Copnick, Roland D’Amour, Judith Gault, Alexis Kanner, Derek May, Louis Negin.

results.title: The Erie Canal
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Peter Spier, the popular folk song about work and life on the Erie Canal is sung by Devin Terreson and brought to life with accurate and detailed illustrations.

results.title: The Environment: garbage
results.brief_description: Uses a montage of garbage cans, music and images, with no narration, to reveal the many kinds of garbage and the need to be aware of the problem. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: The Environment game
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Michael Blakstad
results.brief_description: Technological progress, essential to the economy of an industrial nation, must be subject to checks and controls to prevent the destruction of landscapes and pollution of the quality of life. Using schoolchildren to represent the various interests concerned, the film debates the problems, with visits to various locations to illustrate the issues at stake.

results.title: The Entertainer
results.creator_credit: Robert Stigwood Organisation, Persky-Bright Productions, Beryl Vertue, Marvin Hamlisch and Donald Wrye
results.brief_description: Coping with constant failures, down and almost out comedian Archie Rice (jack Lemmon) lives with his family and his famous retired father Billy (Ray Bolger). He dreams of the day he will be a star. Cast also includes Sada thompson, Tyne Daly, Michael Cristofer. From the play by John Osborne with music by Marvin Hamlisch.

results.title: The Enormous Crocodile
results.brief_description: When the Enormous Crocodile boasts that he is going to eat a child for his lunch the other jungle animals decide to foil his dastardly plot. Children will delight in the exploits of Humpy Rumpy, Muggle Wump and the Roly-Poly bird. The animation is based on the original illustrations of Quentin Blake for another of Roald Dahl’s entertaining moral tales.

results.title: The English language: story of its development
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the English language from its roots in the Anglo and Saxon tongues, through its infusion of French and Latin, and finally its emergence as a printed language which is still growing and changing. The influence of Church monks, William the Conqueror, Chaucer and Shakespeare are discussed.

results.title: The English language: patterns of usage
results.brief_description: The words a person uses, their pronunciation, the construction of phrases and sentences, dialects and speech rhythms are all aspects of usage and style. In this film we see how speech styles and acceptability vary with individuals and culture groups, and in different language situations.

results.title: The English inn
results.creator_credit: Verity Films, Sydney Box, James Carr and Muriel Baker
results.brief_description: The inn is the centre of life in the towns and villages of England. Carved designs and paintings by artists of long ago can still be seen today in these inns. Most of the more pretentious inns were built along the old coaching routes, where they formed a vital part of the communication system.
